author: Jamie Feldman
title: Woman Proudly Shows Off Her Eczema To Prove A Point About Instagram
text:
Woman Proudly Shows Off Her Eczema To Prove A Point About Instagram Instagram doesn't always tell the whole story. By Jamie Feldman 
A picture says a thousand words, but on social media , they don‚Äôt always tell the whole story. 
It‚Äôs a point Carys Gray just proved on her Instagram account, busybeefitness . Her posts typically show off the results of her booty-focused fitness routine and reflect a body positive outlook , but a recent post that has nothing to do with her workouts really struck a chord with followers. A post shared by Carys Gray || Cardiff, UKüá¨üáß (@busybeefitness) on Feb 15, 2017 at 7:57am PST 
Gray posted two side-by-side photos on of her face last week, calling the post a reality check. The first image, she wrote, is ‚Äúhow you see me when my eczema is under control, I‚Äôve done my makeup and I‚Äôm feeling sassy.‚Äù The second, she said, was taken ‚Äúwhen my eczema isn‚Äôt under control, it‚Äôs very blotchy, sore and I can‚Äôt wear any makeup.‚Äù 
The photos are ‚Äú both me, both real and both totally acceptable ,‚Äù she wrote. 
Gray acknowledged that social media is a great way to show ‚Äúthe good parts of people and their lives,‚Äù but she wanted to use this image to remind her 139,000 followers that what you see on social media is ‚Äúnot the full story, it‚Äôs not how that person will look or be a the time!‚Äù 
Indeed. Eczema is common skin condition that affects over 30 million Americans . Symptoms can include redness, itching, inflammation, oozing and swelling of the skin. Promising trials show that relief may be on the way for some, and there are dermatologist-approved remedies and products that help people with eczema cope. Still, there‚Äôs currently no cure . 
The condition is still ‚Äúa big insecurity‚Äù for Gray, she admits, but she said she‚Äôs ‚Äúlearning to accept myself knowing that everyone has their own struggles and insecurities and that‚Äôs what makes us unique and special.‚Äù
